description: SayText function in Kismet 2.2.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters (backtick or pipe) in the essid argument.

description: The library feature for Adobe Content Server 3.0 allows a remote attacker to check out an eBook for an arbitrary length of time via a modified loanMin parameter to download.asp.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1019

description: The library feature for Adobe Content Server 3.0 allows a remote attacker to check out an eBook even when the maximum number of loans is exceeded by accessing the "Add to bookbag" feature when the server reports that no more copies are available.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1020

description: BadBlue server allows remote attackers to read restricted files, such as EXT.INI, via an HTTP request that contains a hex-encoded null byte.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1021

description: BadBlue server stores passwords in plaintext in the ext.ini file, which could allow local and possibly remote attackers to gain privileges.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1022

description: BadBlue server allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an HTTP GET request without a URI.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1023

description: Cisco IOS 12.0 through 12.2, when supporting SSH, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a large packet that was designed to exploit the SSH CRC32 attack detection overflow (CVE-2001-0144).

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2002-1024
